subject: Investing
title: The Role of Market Makers
description: A quick win: understand The Role of Market Makers.

hook.text: You want to sell a stock right now, but no buyer is waiting. A market maker steps in and buys it anyway.

buildup.text: Market makers are firms that always offer to buy and sell a stock. They provide liquidity around the clock.

discovery.text: They profit from the spread â€” buying at the bid and selling at the ask. Pennies per share, millions of times.

twist.text: In a crash, market makers can widen spreads or pull out entirely. Liquidity vanishes when you need it most.

climax.text: Citadel Securities handles about 25% of all US stock trades. One firm, a quarter of the market.

punchline.text: Market makers are the oil in the engine. Without them, markets seize up.

quiz.question: How do market makers primarily earn their profit?
options: From the bid-ask spread on each trade
